case_vignette:
A 3-year-old female presents with her mother for evaluation of a rash present for two days. Mother notes the patient developed a runny nose, cough, and fever four days prior to onset of rash which began as small raised red bumps on the chest and progressively spread to arms and legs. Mother denies any medication exposures or new topical products. Physical examination reveals multiple juicy, monomorphic erythematous pink scattered papules on the arms, legs, buttock with sparing of the chest and back. The patient is up to date with vaccinations. The patient is afebrile at the time of presentation. The mother reports that the patient has been taking acetaminophen for fever reduction. The patient is otherwise healthy and has no significant past medical history.
Original text:
A 3-year-old boy presents with his mother for evaluation of a rash present for two days. Mother notes the patient developed a runny nose, cough, and fever four days prior to onset of rash which began as small raised red bumps on the chest and progressively spread to arms and legs. Mother denies any medication exposures or new topical products. Physical examination reveals multiple juicy, monomorphic erythematous pink scattered papules on the arms, legs, buttock with sparing of the chest and back. The patient is up to date with vaccinations. The patient is afebrile at the time of presentation. The mother reports that the patient has been taking acetaminophen for fever reduction. The patient is otherwise healthy and has no significant past medical history.

I have a rash, a runny nose, cough, and earlier I had a fever.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had the runny nose, cough, and fever for about six days, and the rash for two days.

The rash looks like small raised red bumps and it started on my chest, then spread to my arms and legs.

No, I don't have any significant past medical history or history of similar symptoms.

No, there's no family history of similar symptoms or skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Measles
